newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak FDI to end-Dec 96 total hits $887 mln.
newsitem.headline: Slovak FDI to end-Dec 96 total hits $887 mln.

text.p: Cumulative foreign direct investment (FDI) into Slovakia from January 1990 to the end of 1996 totalled $887 million, the Slovak Statistical Bureau (SUSR) said on Thursday.
"FDI increased by $42 million, or 5.3 percent, against the first three quarters of 1996, and rose by $153.9 million, 21.9 percent, from the beginning of the year," a SUSR statement said.

Six countries -- Austria, Germany, the Czech Republic, Britain, Netherlands and France -- have invested more than one billion crowns in Slovakia between January 1990 and December 1996, together accounting for 85.3 percent of total FDI placed in the country over the matched period.
Neighbouring Austria again led all countries with investment totalling "almost" six billion crowns, the SUSR said.
The largest portion of foreign investment went to industrial production, totalling 10.461 billion crowns and accounting for 39.2 percent of the overall FDI.
The largest foreign investment projects were Britain's Tesco Stores, Germany's Volkswagen Bratislava car production plant and Norway's Slovalco aluminium production joint-venture.
